data.title: Who is Lionel Messi? What to know about the soccer star facing FC Cincinnati this week
data.meta_description: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami CF come to Cincinnati on Wednesday for the U.S. Open Cup semifinals. Here are some facts about Messi.
data.text:
Lionel Messi and Inter Miami CF will travel to Cincinnati on Wednesday for the semifinal round of the U.S. Open Cup.

Inter Miami CF and FC Cincinnati play at TQL Stadium at 7 p.m. Wednesday. Fans can watch the match on CBS Sports Golazo Network, CBSSports.com, Paramount+ and locally on Star64.

Messi joined Major League Soccer this year. The 36-year-old forward is the top goal-scorer for Argentina and Barcelona, and is widely considered one of the best soccer players of all time. Here are answers to some of the most-Googled questions about the soccer phenomenon.

Who is Lionel Messi?

Lionel Messi is an Argentine professional soccer player. The all-time leading goal scorer for Argentina and Barcelona, Messi holds numerous awards, including two for the Best FIFA Menâ€™s Player.

What team does Messi play for?

Messi, who plays forward, is team captain for Inter Miami CF of the MLS. He also plays for Argentina's national team. Messi spent the majority of his career playing for La Liga's Barcelona, which he left in 2021.

How many World Cups has Messi won?

Messi won his first World Cup with Argentina in 2022.

How many kids does Messi have?

Messi and his wife, Antonela Roccuzzo, share three sons: Thiago, Mateo and Ciro. According to People, Thiago was born in 2012, Mateo in 2015 and Ciro arrived in 2018.

What is Lionel Messi's salary

Messi joined Inter Miami CF this year, agreeing to a deal worth up to $150 million over two-and-a-half years, plus additional funds from MLS partners, according to Sportico. He is expected to make between $50 million and $60 million per year with the club.

The outlet estimates that by the end of 2025, the soccer star's career earnings will reach around $1.6 billion.
